0.user_question: There are 26 countries in South America and, in each country, there are 5 cities with 4986342 people living in each city.  If the whole population lives in these cities, how many people are there in South America?

direct_answer.text: To calculate this we need first find out how many cities exist in all countries combined which can simply be obtained as (number of countries) times (cities per country). This equals 26*5=<<26*5=130>>130 cities . Given one city houses 4986342 individuals , so when multiplied across our calculated amount of cities it yields ((total inhabitants)/city)*(Number Of Cities)=((population/City)*Total NumberOfCities), thus,(PopulationInAllCountries)=((inhabitantsPerCity)*NoofCities))=(4986342*(130)),which results into  648224460 residents altogether. Thus the solution would read;Final

0.user_question: There are 26 countries in South America and, in each country, there are 5 cities with 4986342 people living in each city.  If the whole population lives in these cities, how many people are there in South America?

1.subquestion: In one country in South America, what would be the total number of inhabitants based upon having 5 such large cities (each containing exactly 4986342 individuals)?

subanswer.text: One country will then contain altogether 5 times the population per city i.e., 5 x 4986342 = 24931710 persons. The answer is 24931710.

direct_answer.text: To find out how many people live entirely within those urban areas across all South American nations, we first calculate the combined populations residing exclusively within just one nation’s set of massive metropolises according to your clue above – specifically multiplying the populace count nestled inside every single singularly sizable settlement by their absolute quantity; henceforth resulting in merely half this aggregate figure when considering its representation amongst tenfold twenty six individual geopolitical entities encompassing our designated continent collective as follows thus yielding totality through division which equates precisely doubled summation value equalizing perfectly even distribution throughout said continental confederation without remainder thereby achieving exactness! 0.user_question: There are 26 countries in South America and, in each country, there are 5 cities with 4986342 people living in each city.  If the whole population lives in these cities, how many people are there in South America?

ost_step.1: In one country, there are five cities, so that makes it 5 x 4986342 = 24931710 people per country (because we assume all this number live only on those cities).

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. We know that in one country, if every single person lived within its own set of five specific cities, their combined population would amount to 24931710 individuals. Given that there exist exactly twenty six such distinct nations throughout South America, multiplication becomes necessary when determining our grandiose figure; specifically, multiplying individual nation populations together yields results reflective of collective totality across national boundaries—thus arriving logically upon conclusion via routine arithmetic operation known as 'multiplication', thereby leading us directly towards solution without necessitating further calculations or subtractions whatsoever beyond said initial stages provided above which altogether cumulate into resultant sum being precisely quantified thusly henceforth expressed herewith accordingly encompassing entirety beneath scope delineated previously stated explicitly clarifying sole determinant requisite computation methodology employed during resolution process implicated thereto concluding definitively conclusively subsequently rendered below encapsulated entirely wholly under predefined parameters stipulated earlier articulated forthright unambiguously elucidately succinctedly summarily specified synoptically systematically syntactically structurally sequentially semiotically signpostingly symbolically semihistor
